page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY: The Bomb
page.content: If you have ever passed Whitehead Gardens on Chapel Street near the Printer's Inn you would be passing a piece of history which literally shook Tottington.Whitehead Gardens looked today a little like they did in the early 1950's shortly after they had been opened. Did you know that where this garden is today there used to be houses? This is what hapened to the houses.On Christmas Eve 1944 during the second world war a flying bomb dropped on Chapel Street.Across the road St. Ann's Church the doors and windows had been blown out and the trees were festooned with clothes.After the war Mr. and Mrs. S.D Whitehead of Stormer Hill bought the land where the bomb had dropped and spent Â£5000 making the gardens out of the ruins.
